recipes.title: Una amplia variedad de mariscos ahora está disponible en
recipes.title_original: A wide array of seafood is now available at
recipes.full_text:
Una amplia variedad de mariscos ahora está disponible en 
supermercados en todo el país, pero no todo es lo mejor 
calidad o fresco. Te daremos algunos consejos básicos sobre 
cómo comprar pescados y mariscos para que los problemas de salud puedan ser 
prevenido.
recipes.full_text_original:
A wide array of seafood is now available at 
supermarkets across the country, but not all is top 
quality or fresh. We will provide some basic tips on 
how to buy fish and seafood so health problems can be 
prevented.

recipes.full_text_original:
Fresh fish should not be kept in the refrigerator 
more than two days. Long term storage of fish usually 
requires freezing. All fish should be cleaned before 
freezing and the quicker the freeze, the better.

recipes.full_text_original:
An excellent way to determine the cooking time 
of fish is to measure the diameter of the fish at its 
widest point, and allow 10 minutes cooking time for 
each inch or fraction thereof. 
For example, if a salmon measured 2-inches at its 
widest point, the cooking time would be 20 minutes.

recipes.full_text_original:
This method is often called the Canadian Method of 
cooking and is widely used by chefs and outdoor 
people. 
Baking should be done at 10 minutes for each 
inch in a 450° F. oven. 
According to some chefs, this approach works 
just as well with frozen fish as it does with fresh. They 
suggest that the fish not be thawed, but cooked frozen 
with the time doubled per inch of diameter. For exam- 
15 

ple, a two-inch diameter will be cooked for 40 minutes 
rather than the 20 for fresh fish. Deep frying frozen 
fish is not recommended. 
Cooking methods fall into at least five catego- 
ries: 1. Deep-frying (boiling the fish 
in oil or lard at 
375° F.), 2. Frying (pan-frying, stir-frying and pan- 
frying), 
3. Dry Cooking (baking, broiling, and oven- 
frying) 4. Wet Cooking (steaming, braising, poaching) 
and 5. Microwave.

Los siguientes son algunos de los métodos básicos de 
cocinar pescado: 
Freír: El pescado se recubre con una masa y 
sumergido en aceite calentado a 375° F. El tiempo de cocción suele ser 
unos 10 minutos por pulgada a esta temperatura. 
Hornear: El horno debe precalentarse para que esté 
entre 425° F. y 450° F. El pescado se puede hornear sin- 
sin envolver o puede envolverse en papel o papel de aluminio para 
que se debería permitir una cantidad adicional de tiempo en 
para que el calor pueda penetrar el revestimiento.

Cubra la superficie donde se colocará el pescado con aceite.
recipes.full_text_original:
The following are some of the basic methods of 
cooking fish: 
Deep Frying: Fish are coated with a batter and 
dipped in oil heated to 375° F. Cooking time is usually 
about 10 minutes per inch at this temperature. 
Baking: The oven should be pre-heated to be- 
tween 425° F. and 450° F. The fish can be baked with- 
out wrapping or it may be wrapped in paper or foil for 
which an extra amount of time should be allowed in 
order that the heat might penetrate the covering. 
Broiling: Before preheating the broiler, be sure to 
coat the surface where the fish will be placed with oil.

recipes.full_text_original:
The fish should positioned about three to four inches 
from the heat (Most broilers will produce heat at the 
500° F. to 525° F. level). If the fish is frozen or dressed, 
place it five inches from the heat. Be sure to baste 
often with oil or butter. 
16 

Grilling: This method of cooking fish and seafood 
has gained great popularity in recent years and yields 
some great results. Fish should be placed on a well- 
oiled rack or piece of foil and positioned no closer than 
six inches from the flames. Basting frequently is impor- 
tant to prevent the fish from drying out. 
Pan Frying: This method usually requires 1/4- 
inch of melted butter or oil in a pan. The fish is fried 
until golden brown on one side, then it is turned. 
Oven Frying: Preheat the oven to 500° F. and 
placed breaded fish near the top of the oven ona 
lightly greased pan. Baste fish with butter or oil during 
the cooking time. 
Poaching: Bring milk or water to a boil and place 
the fish in it. The timing is the same as with other 
methods---about 10 minutes per inch of thickness. 
Braising: Begin by sauteing carrots, onions and 
a clove of garlic (cut in thin strips) in butter for about 
five minutes. Arrange them on the bottom of a frying 
pan then place the fish on top. Pour in red or white 
wine or a mixture of wine and fish bouillon until it 
covers one-half the fish. Once the liquid reaches a boil, 
allow 10 minutes cooking time per inch of thickness. 
Steaming: Position fish on a plate or rack above 
boiling water. Place a lid over the pot or wok. Cooking 
time will follow the Canadian Method described above. 
17

recipes.full_text_original:
Creamy Mustard Sauce 
Serve over broiled or poached fish. 
1 1/2 cups of cream 
4 Tbsp. mustard 
3/4 cup onion or chives, finely chopped 
Salt and pepper 
Optional: white wine (1/2 cup) 
1. If you use chopped onion, saute for 3 to 4 minutes 
in butter until the onion is clear. If you use chives, 
they need not be sautéed. You may choose to use 
a mix of onion and chives. 
2. If you wish to use wine, add about 1/2 cup to the 
onions and heat until nearly all of it has evaporat- 
ed; stir occasionally so that the onions do not 
burn. 
Courtesy Duane R. Lund, Sauces, Seasonings and Marinades 
for Fish and 
Wild Game.

2. Cocine el apio y la cebolla en 3 cucharadas. mantequilla hasta

recipes.full_text_original:
Lemon Stuffed Fish 
4 fish fillets (1 1/2 lbs. each) 
1/2 cup celery, finely chopped 
1/4 cup onion, chopped 
3 Tbsp. butter 
4 cups dry bread cubes or croutons 
1/2 tsp. lemon peel, grated 
4 tsp. lemon juice 
1 Tbsp. parsley, snipped 
1 Tbsp. butter, melted 
1. Place 2 fillets in a greased baking pan. 
2. Cook celery and onion in 3 Tbsp. butter until 
crisp tender. 
3. Pour over bread. 
4. Add lemon peel and juice, parsley, 1/2 tsp. salt and 
a dash of pepper, then toss together. 
5. Spoon half the stuffing mixture on each fillet in the 
pan. 
6. Top with remaining two pieces of fish, brush with 
1 Tbsp. butter. Sprinkle with salt and paprika 
and bake, covered at 350° F. for about 25 minutes. 
99

recipes.full_text:
sopa de pescado 
6 rebanadas de tocino 
3 patatas grandes 
2 latas de almejas picadas o 1 Ib. de pescado deshuesado (fresco 
o agua salada) 
2 cebollas medianas 
1 litro de leche 
Sal, pimienta y mantequilla al gusto 
1. Freír el tocino crujiente. Desmoronarse. 
2. Cortar las patatas y las cebollas en dados. 
3. Saltee las cebollas en la grasa del tocino hasta que estén transparentes. 
4. Ponga el pescado en una olla sopera con patatas, cebollas y ba- 
estafa. Sazone ligeramente. 
5. Agregue suficiente agua para cubrir y cocine a fuego lento hasta que el pescado 
y las patatas están listas. 
6. Agregue la leche y cocine a fuego lento durante 15 minutos. No hervir. 
7. Agregue más condimentos si es necesario. Puede variar el sabor según 
agregando una pequeña cantidad de azúcar. Servir caliente. 
Cortesía de Jack Cooper, Indianápolis, Indiana. 
107
recipes.full_text_original:
Fish Chowder 
6 slices bacon 
3 large potatoes 
2 cans minced clams or 1 Ib. of de-boned fish (fresh 
or saltwater) 
2 medium onions 
1 quart milk 
Salt, pepper and butter to taste 
1. Fry bacon crisp. Crumble. 
2. Dice potatoes and onions. 
3. Saute the onions in the bacon fat until transparent. 
4. Put fish in soup pot with potatoes, onions and ba- 
con. Season lightly. 
5. Add enough water to cover and simmer until fish 
and potatoes are done. 
6. Add milk and simmer for 15 minutes. Do not boil. 
7. Add further seasoning if needed. Can vary taste by 
adding a small amount of sugar. Serve hot. 
Courtesy Jack Cooper, Indianapolis, Indiana. 
107

My friend, Achish Featherbelt, gave up on ice fishing 
last year. By the time he cut a hole in the ice big 
enough to put his boat in, he was too tired to fish. 
133 

Pickled Fish - A 
Fillet fish and cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces. Bring 4 cups 
of water to boil and 1 tsp. salt. Drop about 6 pieces of 
fish into boiling water at a time. Boil 1 minute. Drain. 
Then in pyrex bow! alternate layers of fish and sliced 
onion. Add to this 1/2 tsp. whole pickling spice. Bring 
to a boil: 4 cups white vinegar, 2 cups water, 1 cup 
sugar, 1/2 cup plus 1 Tbsp. salt. Pour this over fish, let 
stand till cooled. Keep refrigerated. 
Pickled Fish-B 
Place left-over fish in bowl. In a skillet add 2 Tbsp. oil, 
medium sliced onion, 4 or 5 leaves of sage and simmer 
for a few minutes until onion is tender. In a sauce pan, 
heat 1 cup wine vinegar, and 1 cup water. When hot, 
pour into skillet and stir and then pour over fish. The 
liquid should almost cover fish.

recipes.full_text_original:
Seafood Soup 
1/2 lb. shrimp, shelled, deveined and cut in half cross- 
wise 
1/2 lb. sea scallops, coarsely chopped 
1 16-0z. can whole new potatoes, drained and 
diced 
1 clove garlic, crushed 
1/4 cup butter or margarine 
2/3 cup all-purpose flour 
2 13 3/4 fluid oz. cans chicken broth 
1/2 tsp. ground white pepper 
1 cup light cream or half-and-half 
1. 
In large saucepan, over medium heat, cook 
shrimp, scallops, potatoes and garlic in 
margarine until seafood is done. 
2. 
Stir in flour until blended. Gradually add 
chicken broth and pepper. Heat to a boil, 
stirring constantly. Boil 1 minute. 
3. 
Stir in light cream; heat through. Do not boil.

recipes.title: Bisque de camarones de Maine
ingredients: 1 taza de apio, cortado en cubitos
poner en agua con sal hirviendo rápidamente; cubrir; hervir
Vierta la leche en una cacerola; agregue la hoja de laurel, la cebolla
recipes.full_text:
Bisque de camarones de Maine 
1 libra camarones frescos 
4 tazas de leche 
1 hoja de laurel 
2 rodajas de cebolla 
1 taza de apio, cortado en cubitos 
3 cucharadas. perejil, picado 
1/3 taza de mantequilla 
1/3 taza de harina 
3/4 cucharadita sal 
1/8 cucharadita. pimienta 
1. 
Lave bien los camarones con agua corriente fría; 
poner en agua con sal hirviendo rápidamente; cubrir; hervir 
15 minutos; drenar. 
2. 
Retirar del caparazón y quitar la vena negra. 
Picar en trozos pequeños. 
3. 
Vierta la leche en una cacerola; agregue la hoja de laurel, la cebolla 
rodajas, apio y perejil. 
4. 
Escaldar la leche unos 2 minutos; no hervir. 
5. 
Derrita la mantequilla en una cacerola profunda a fuego lento; 
agregue la harina, la sal y la pimienta. 
195 

6. 
Cuando esté muy suave añadir poco a poco la leche escaldada, 
agregue los camarones revolviendo constantemente hasta que la mezcla 
hierve. Cocine 5 minutos, revolviendo constantemente.
recipes.full_text_original:
Maine Shrimp Bisque 
1 Ib. fresh shrimp 
4 cups milk 
1 bay leaf 
2 slices onion 
1 cup celery, diced 
3 Tbsp. parsley, chopped 
1/3 cup butter 
1/3 cup flour 
3/4 tsp. salt 
1/8 tsp. pepper 
1. 
Wash shrimp thoroughly in cold running water; 
put into rapidly boiling salted water; cover; boil 
15 minutes; drain. 
2. 
Remove from shells and take out black vein. 
Chop into tiny pieces. 
3. 
Pour milk into saucepan; add bay leaf, onion 
slices, celery, and parsley. 
4. 
Scald milk about 2 minutes; do not boil. 
5. 
Melt butter in deep saucepan over low flame; 
stir in flour, salt, and pepper. 
195 

6. 
When very smooth, gradually add scalded milk, 
add shrimp stirring constantly until mixture 
boils. Cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly.

Snacks 
1 Ib. shrimp 
1/4 cup soy sauce

Combine soy sauce, sugar, garlic, ginger root,

Cut bacon slices in thirds. Wrap piece of 
bacon around each shrimp; skewer to secure. 
3. 
Grill bacon-wrapped shrimp over hot coals

brushing with soy mixture frequently.

recipes.full_text:
Camarones A La Parrilla

1 cucharadita sal 
pizca de pimienta

2 onions, chopped

Dash of pepper 
1 clove garlic, minced 
1/2 cup parsley, chopped

1/2 cup water 
1. 
Saute onion, celery and seasonings in olive oil,

Add shrimp, and stir over moderate heat until 
moisture is absorbed.

Add wine vinegar, or 4 Tbsp. white wine,

Cook about 15 minutes. (A bay leaf may be 
added for extra flavor).

Seaman's Stew

but), cut in large chunks

2 Tbsp. vegetable oil

3 cups water 
1/2 tsp. each: red pepper and black pepper 
1 cup parsley, finely chopped 
1/3 cup dry white wine 
6 slices of Italian bread (toasted, if desired) 
1/2 tsp. salt 
1. 
Sprinkle fish with 1/2 tsp. salt; let stand 1 hour. 
2. 
Meanwhile, lightly brown onion in hot oil; 
drain. 
3. 
Stir in water, Hunt's Tomato Paste, red pepper, 
black pepper, 1 1/2 tsp. salt, parsley and wine. 
4. 
Simmer 20 minutes. 
5. 
Add fish, simmer about 10 minutes longer or 
just until fish flakes easily with a fork. 
6. 
To serve, place a slice of bread in each soup 
bowl; ladle soup over.
